title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
content: The Great Gatsby is a 1925 novel by American writer F. Scott Fitzgerald that follows a cast of characters living in the fictional town of West Egg on prosperous Long Island in the summer of 1922.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
content: Published in 1960, it was immediately successful, winning the Pulitzer Prize, and has become a classic of modern American literature.

author: George Orwell
content: 1984, a dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale, was published in 1949 by English writer George Orwell.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
content: Pride and Prejudice is an 1813 novel of manners written by Jane Austen. The novel follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
content: The Catcher in the Rye is a 1951 novel by J.D. Salinger. The novel's protagonist Holden Caulfield has become an icon for teenage rebellion.
